author: Gero Wallet
title: Gero Wallet: Cardano's MetaMask
description: As Cardano is going live, users need a safe, efficient, and affordable way for their ADA tokens to interact with ADA contracts.

assessments.note: The proposal is at the right place, addresses the issue of having a metamask like wallet for Cardano. Metrics, goals and time plan is however not available. I would welcome a bit more in this part, because the proposal has a good potential.
This is probably a great idea. However there is too little information in the proposal.

Intuitively, this is a sorely needed thing in the cardano ecosystem. There is stiff competition between Gero and Yoroi. With dcSpark being launched it may be completed. However, this project doesn't provide any examples of what cross chain swaps, how EUTXO will be used to facilitate it, how the wallet will be used for all the other purposes listed in the lite paper.

The problem description makes sense, the proposal is related to the challenge, but it is important to indicate that EMURGO is already developing a dapp connector for for YOROI wallet, which is Cardano's official wallet. Wallets are mission critical software and need high standards of security and quality. The vast majority of users and transactions related to DeFi on Ethereum occur through only one wallet, Metamask, so having multiple wallets is not a requirement to have a functioning DeFi ecosystem.

The creation of an unofficial wallet by an unknown team, the absence of a detailed and structured plan and the absence of goals or metrics do not indicate a positive outcome for this proposal in relation to this challenge and for Cardano's ecosystem.

I recommend that the team describe details about the plan, indicate who will be involved in the proposal and what additional benefit Gero Wallet would bring over the official wallets (Yoroi and Daedalus).

Team experience is given, but there aren't any work references, based on what it could be decided whether the given information is true. Requested budget spending isn't listed neither and the long term plans would also welcome some thought.
There is no detailed plan or evidence of capability. Thus it is unlikely to be successfully delivered.

The only piece of information provided about the team is that they are 'in since 2017' and are associates of cardstarter defi projects. No plan for implementation, detailed budget, or defined scope of work was included.

The team described experience in the development of several DeFi dapps since 2017 and described working with the main Cardano launchpad, but there is no information available to make it possible to verify these allegations, so there is no way to indicate the team's aptitude to develop this proposal.

There is no solid plan, just a draft.

There is no budget breakdown.

I recommend including this information so that we can give you appropriate feedback.

Due to missing time plan and risk overview it is hard to judge on audibility. I would welcome some more efforts on reworking the complete project time plan and spending in order that it gets rewarded.
The current proposal is an idea with a placeholder webpage. Please provide a detailed plan and evidence of capability to deliver on that plan.
The proposal doesn't include any self identified key metrics or goals, or even if this is a general project or specific for certain dapps. Very difficult to audit without goalposts identified.
There is no information to audit this proposal. I recommend that the proposal be drawn up based on the Catalyst documentation.

solution: We are creating Gero Wallet, a web browser wallet and extension for users to safely store tokens and interact with dApps built on Cardano.
experience: Our group has built multiple DeFi projects and is intimately working with the main Cardano launchpad giving us early access to all dApps.
